==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|セイウチ|海象 (Walrus)}}
{{wikipedia|Walrus}}
[[File:Noaa-walrus22.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|海象}} (''seiuchi'', ''kaizō''): a '''[[walrus]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=せいうち}}
{{bor|ja|ru|сивуч||{{l|en|Steller sea lion}}}}.<ref>{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref>{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref>{{R:Kojien}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

The kanji are {{juku|sort=せいうち}}, from {{der|ja|ltc|海象|sort=せいうち}}. See ''kaizō'' below.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|acc=0|セイウチ|y=i|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|セイウチ}}

# a {{l|en|walrus}}

=====Usage notes=====
{{U:ja:biology|セイウチ}} Not to be confused with {{m|ja|象海豹|tr=zō azarashi||{{l|en|elephant seal}}}}.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|ぞう}}
{{IPAchar|/kaizau/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaizɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaizoː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|海象|tr=xoj<sup>X</sup> zjang<sup>X</sup>|lit=[[sea]] [[elephant]]|sort=かいぞう}}. Compare {{cog|yue|海象|tr=hoi<sup>2</sup> zoeng<sup>6</sup>}}, {{cog|vi|hải tượng}}.

The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading, so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|かいぞう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいぞう|hhira=かいざう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かいぞう|rare}} a {{l|en|walrus}}

=====Usage notes=====
This reading is much less common than ''seiuchi''.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|しょう}}
{{IPAchar|/kaiɕau/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaiɕɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaiɕoː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=かいしょう|海象|tr=xoj<sup>X</sup> zjang<sup>X</sup>|lit=sea + [[phenomenon]]}}. Alternatively, may have been coined in Japan as a compound of {{cog|ltc|-}}-derived roots.

The [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading, so likely either a later borrowing, or a later innovation in Japan.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|かいしょう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいしょう|hhira=かいしやう}}

# a {{l|en|marine}} {{l|en|phenomenon}}
